topics.body:
!http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/692/917/fa4.jpg!
You guys do realize how stupid it is to argue over this considering that this whole debate is going to be over in a couple years when both organic and gmo are no longer being eaten anyhow?  This is like arguing whether the PS1 or the original Xbox is the best next gen console in 2014.

The reason why we don't synthesized food yet is costs due to mass manufacturing it would be too high(right now even if it were put into mass manufacturing it would cost twice as much).  In ten years it'll be cheap enough to kill off both gmo and naturally grown food as a whole industry wise.  In other words this argument is stupid in the long run because there won't be farms in ten years so both unmodified food and gmo will both be out of business; instead you're just going to be getting synthesized food instead.


Ten years from now
!http://img2.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20090306201145/memoryalpha/en/images/a/a2/FoodSynthesizer.jpg!


And before you give me that, "They took muh job" crap this would actually massively improve the economy and create millions of jobs, reduce farmland usage, reduce pollution, reduce our annual amount of oil used, increase health of individuals drastically due to being able to eat as much fast food as they want and still be eating healthy and potentially end world hunger.

Now *BOTH* of you sit in the corner and think about what you've done before I bitchslap you both with science again.

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53687743636872121d210000#post_53687743636872121d210000
I don't see how printed meat would be dangerous. If it is made in a sterile lab, it will have neither bacteria nor diseases from a dead animal nor bacteria nor diseases from slaughterhouse environments. I could see a future industry in growing great white shark teeth or rhino horns using stem cells as well, allowing people to have impressive animal parts without killing endangered species.

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5368783a63687226d2220000#post_5368783a63687226d2220000
I can also see food that is still artificial. Nature has it figured out and out bodies are tuned to eat things that are from nature. Food without some bacteria or other pathogens on it may sound good at first but keep in mind, out bodies are designed for that kind of thing. If we eat perfectly sterile food, out bodies will lose their immunity to such pathogens and we could get sick very easily. As an outdoorsman, I can tell you that eating fresh caught fish from a clean lake cooked over an open campfire is far better than some farm raised junk with artificial coloring to make it look healthy.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

That is true but also think of it like this-when you hunt you kill an animal that would be killed anyway and very painfully and brutally with just a quick painless shot that kills it instantly. Animals raised on farms are tortured their entire miserable lives being confined to small pens, being injected with antibiotics to prevent them from spreading disease to the other animals which would reduce profits as it would be cheaper just to kill the sick animal than to take take care of it and being force fed "food" to make them grow as large as possible.
